text: Brown County is a county in the U.S. state of Illinois. As of the 2020 census, the population was 6,244. The county seat is Mount Sterling. Siloam Springs State Park is in this county. == History == Brown County was founded in 1839. It is named in honor of U.S. General Jacob Brown, who defeated the British at the Battle of Sackett's Harbor in 1813. == References == Category:1839 establishments in Illinois Category:Illinois counties
title: Brown County, Illinois
